docs.lead_paragraph: British TV and music mogul Simon Cowell, who had long said fatherhood was not in his plans, welcomed a son on Friday, his representative AnnMarie Thomson said.

headline.main: Simon Cowell's Girlfriend Gives Birth to Boy in New York
headline.print_headline: Simon Cowell's Girlfriend Gives Birth to Boy in New York

docs.snippet: British TV and music mogul Simon Cowell, who had long said fatherhood was not in his plans, welcomed a son on Friday, his representative AnnMarie Thomson said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wendy Davis, the Texas state senator who filibustered abortion restrictions last year, told a Dallas newspaper she would have supported one restriction had it been written differently.

headline.main: Wendy Davis, Texas Candidate, Offers Nuance on Abortion View
headline.print_headline: Texas Candidate Offers Nuance on Abortion View

docs.abstract: Texas gubernatorial candidate Wendy Davis, Democratic state senator who filibustered abortion restrictions in 2013, tells Dallas newspaper she would have supported one restriction--ban on abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy--had bill been written differently.
docs.snippet: Wendy Davis, the Texas state senator who filibustered abortion restrictions last year, told a Dallas newspaper she would have supported one restriction had it been written differently.

docs.lead_paragraph: A pregnant woman who was loading groceries into the trunk of her car with her husband was struck and killed by a small bulldozer in Sunset Park, Brooklyn.

headline.main: Bulldozer Clearing Snow Kills a Pregnant Woman
headline.print_headline: Bulldozer Clearing Snow Kills a Pregnant Woman

docs.abstract: New York City Police report a bulldozer clearing snow struck and killed Min Lin, pregnant woman who was grocery shopping in Sunset Park, Brooklyn; doctors saved Lin's baby, who is in critical condition.
docs.snippet: A pregnant woman who was loading groceries into the trunk of her car with her husband was struck and killed by a small bulldozer in Sunset Park, Brooklyn.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and JEFFREY E. SINGER

docs.lead_paragraph: The strange history of women, sensuality and chocolate.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Samira Kawash examines the strange history of women, sensuality and chocolate, on the occasion of Valentine's Day; notes the way advertising of chocolate targeted at women has changed.
docs.snippet: The strange history of women, sensuality and chocolate.

docs.lead_paragraph: A guide to movies playing at theaters in the New York City area, as well as select film series.
docs.snippet: A guide to movies playing at theaters in the New York City area, as well as select film series.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mississippi lawmakers took steps to become the latest U.S. state to ban abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy by passing a measure on Thursday that seeks to further restrict access to the procedure.

headline.main: Mississippi Lawmakers Move Forward on 20-Week Abortion Ban
headline.print_headline: Mississippi Lawmakers Move Forward on 20-Week Abortion Ban

docs.snippet: Mississippi lawmakers took steps to become the latest U.S. state to ban abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy by passing a measure on Thursday that seeks to further restrict access to the procedure.

docs.lead_paragraph: An Iowa prosecutor added a child endangerment charge Thursday against a woman suspected of kidnapping her half sister's newborn and leaving him behind a gas station for more than a day in freezing temperatures.

headline.main: Suspect in Wis. Newborn Kidnapping Charged in Iowa
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Wis. Newborn Kidnapping Charged in Iowa

docs.snippet: An Iowa prosecutor added a child endangerment charge Thursday against a woman suspected of kidnapping her half sister's newborn and leaving him behind a gas station for more than a day in freezing temperatures.

docs.lead_paragraph: Women have a higher risk of blood clots that can cause strokes, heart attacks and other problems for 12 weeks after childbirth — twice as long as doctors have thought, new research finds.

headline.main: Blood Clot Risk Lasts for 12 Weeks After Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: Blood Clot Risk Lasts for 12 Weeks After Pregnancy

docs.snippet: Women have a higher risk of blood clots that can cause strokes, heart attacks and other problems for 12 weeks after childbirth — twice as long as doctors have thought, new research finds.

docs.lead_paragraph: Corrections appearing in print on February 13, 2014.
docs.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on February 13, 2014.

docs.lead_paragraph: Strides in reproductive health, pay and literacy are noted, but the world’s poorest countries have not kept up, the report finds.

headline.main: U.N. Report Says Progress for Women Is Unequal
headline.print_headline: U.N. Report Says Progress for Women Is Unequal

docs.abstract: United Nations report finds that women worldwide have fewer children, are less likely to die of childbirth and have made great strides in literacy 20 years after it called on countries around the world to allow women greater control over their health and destiny; notes that world's poorest countries have not kept up.
docs.snippet: Strides in reproductive health, pay and literacy are noted, but the world’s poorest countries have not kept up, the report finds.
